This game is great.  Really enjoy it and probably one of the best two player board games that I have ever played.
The game is probably the "best" 7-player game. However, if you have less people than that, there are better games than this.
My highest rated game currently. I love the curve to the game and how if you miss it, you are S.O.L. I also like the variability from game to game.
Specifically want Avalon Hill large box version
The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac

Excellent game with a lot of variability.  I am not very good at it, and usually lose, but that aside, it's a good game.
Age of Steam Expansion: Amazon Rainforest & Sahara Desert
Age of Steam Expansion: Chile, Egypt and CCCP
Egypt:  Too many ideas on one map.  The ideas should have been broken into multiple maps, instead of all being on one map.
Age of Steam Expansion: China / South America
Age of Steam Expansion: Mississippi Steamboats / Golden Spike
Age of Steam Expansion: Secret Blueprints of Steam Plans 1 & 2

Make sure you only play with honest people, as there can be some extreme cheating that can happen on this map.  This map however is a great expansion, and is a great way to get people into Age of Steam.
Age of Steam Expansion: The Zombie Apocalypse
Very reminiscent of Caylus.  The abundance of cards makes this game very different from play to play.  Will probably get it when it is released in English.
Agricola:  All Creatures Big and Small

At it's roots, a dice game.  Has more strategy than a standard dice game such as "To court the king".  Of course the first time I played I was the Germans, and I won by building the 2 biggest parts of the Hindenburg.  Go figure.
Horrible artwork. The game is okay, but the color choices and fonts are so distracting to the game.
I liked this game, but I felt like something was missing. Would like to play again.
Fun tile laying game.  Supposedly the trick is in the walls.  I will have to find out.
I have decided, I hate dice games.
All Things Zombie: Better Dead Than Zed!

After owning this game for 3 months I finally was able to play a two player game.  The game is similar to dungeoneer but has a lot of things that fix the brokenness of dungeoneer.  Think that a 4 player game would be the best number of people to play this with.
Cute little game. I prefer not to play dexterity games, but if that's all there is. :)
Fun game. The board is too busy, but the game is solid.
This game is very simple to understand and I am always interested in playing.  One of the main reasons I like this game is that you are not required to fight.
Too many chits. Would make a great computer game. Is the essence of a fiddly game.
Cute game.  Doesn't really get me, due to lack of planning with the dice roll.
Dolphin on the cover of a game, is just as bad as a Panda.

If you like the whole you vs. "EVERYTHING THAT CAN BE THROWN AT YOU" premise, then you will enjoy this game.  The game being explained to me went something  like this: "If situation a happens you die. If situation b happens you die.  If situation c happens you when but only if situation d is not true.  If time expires, then your pretty much screwed, because you have to fight the old great one, and they are just super powerful."

After stating this, the person explaining the game to me must of seen the horrific look in my face stating, "How the hell does anyone win this game."  He said, "Don't worry, your supposed to feel helpless."

On a side note:  My team (6 of us were playing) did win the first time we played.

If you like the whole you vs. "EVERYTHING THAT CAN BE THROWN AT YOU" premise, then you will enjoy this game.  The game being explained to me went something  like this: "If situation a happens you die. If situation b happens you die.  If situation c happens you when but only if situation d is not true.  If time expires, then your pretty much screwed, because you have to fight the old great one, and they are just super powerful."

After stating this, the person explaining the game to me must of seen the horrific look in my face stating, "How the hell does anyone win this game."  He said, "Don't worry, your supposed to feel helpless."

On a side note:  My team (6 of us were playing) did win the first time we played.
Clever card game that feels like a board game. Civilization Building with Set Collection.

Probably the most solid deck building game I have played. It is quick and simple to teach.

I agree with others who have stated, "It is what Thunderstone, should have been."

The way the asteroids moves is great. However, The programing of the ship is not fun.

Not a big fan of programming games, such as Robo Rally.
Cute kids game. Good way to get them into Euro games.
Automania: The Game of the Motor Giants
Liked this game when I was 10-12, however, much better games have come along. :)
This is the best two-player game that I have played. Hands down, simple to teach, and great for wife/significant other.

Scabble Lite. After playing this a few time I was curious why they didn't sell the idea to the Scabble franchise. A few weeks later I started seeing the "Scabble Pears."

What a rip.

Very simple and light game.  Expansion is required if you play with more than two people.  The games sweet spot is 3-4 players however and is very light hearted.  Works well with people who can adlib what is going on with all the bands when they play cards.  "Your alcoholic singer should of layed off the alcohol he died of overdose."  When you play a band member is killed off card. :)
Battle of the Bands: Backstage Pass
Battle of the Bands: Encore Edition
If your going to play battle of the bands, you might as well have more cards.
Battleship Galaxies: The Saturn Offensive Game Set
A quick pick-up and play game. Great game for non-gamers and kids.
Betrayal at House on the Hill

For how simple this game is, I think it is very clever.

Unfortunately, you can not find it in the states.  Big Disappointment.  I would love to see this game imported.  Great filler.

I would be willing to give this game one more try, because, I want to like it. However, I think the rules are so poorly written that it is hard to "like" this game.

I have played this twice... Both times wrong and both times with different rules explainers.

Hopefully, the next time it will go better.
I am so awful at this game.  I am awful at most spacial reasoning games.  This game however is a lot of fun.
Blood Bowl: Team Manager - The Card Game

Good game if you have the right people.  I also think that if you put on some 30's music and acted in character this game would be a lot more fun.  Game is a little slow moving at times, but all in all a worthwhile game.

This game was very enjoyable once I got past all the rules.  The rules aren't super complicated, there are just a lot of them.  Fortunately the first time I played everyone else playing with me had played multiple times, which made the learning experience that much easier.

Great game and I enjoy it very much.  Building ships is key to success I think. :)
You remember that card game speed you used to play when you were a kid?  This is the same game, just rearranged so that it trips you up a little while until you get the hang of it.
Cute game, however, the people you play with will really make or break your playing experience.  Hard for someone who just learning to be accepted into the group.
An excellent minimal version of it's larger counterpart. You get the feel of playing BSG without having to take an hour. The "liar's dice" component is very clever.

Great light game to get a game weekend started.  Game is includes other additions that can make the game more fun than just the base game, such as "Cop" (Think Reservoir Dogs) and Super Powers such as after a person dies you get to use their gun.

The Cop version of the game is not very enjoyable because it is too difficult for the Cop to Win.
New take on Cash and Guns, as opposed to everyone for themselves, puts a nice twist by having "Gangs".
Similar to battle line, but also have the ability to put cards face down. Fairly interesting card game.
Meh.  Not a bad game... Cute, but I think I would rather play something else.
Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
Wow.  Really?  You want to play a dice game with a lot of down time?  I don't have the patience. Pass.

Pretty standard starting game for people who are new to the concept of a Victory Point System of winning.  Good game and can be pretty strategic if you know what is left in the bag and can keep track of which pieces have been drawn/are left to draw.

Very simple card management game. It is actually a great kids game to get them more into boardgames.

Only play the "Advanced" Rules.
After a few plays, I am very take it or leave it. I understand the excitement, but I think it is overhyped.
A very good two player version of Settlers.  Very easy to teach if you have played Settlers before.
Never played. After reading the rules determined it is not a game for me.
I love this game, but I am horrible at it.  Every person I teach it to runs over me.  I am still willing to teach and play it though. :)
Clever card game. You need to play it 3 or 4 times before giving up on it. The game is not as chaotic as you first think it is.
Great small publisher game.  The key to this game is understanding the amount of rails (cubes) available to each railway, and the dilution of shares.  Fun mechanics that work really great together.
I like this game a lot more than I should.  Very simple mechanics and very easy to learn.  I think it has enough strategy to keep me entertained and little setup time make this game a keeper.

Game is a great buy for $20.  Comes with the expansion and has awesome amounts of strategy involved.  One of the best parts about the game is the roles.  You can't target players directly, you can only target the roles, and you don't know who is who.  Makes for a great evening.

Played with 3, and nearly dominated the board until I couldn't feed my people.  The other two players thought that I was clearly leading the game and were tempted to succeed, however, they wanted to finish the game.  Ended up having the least amount of points out of everyone.  Interesting game.  Would like to play again.
There are a few rules questions that I have posted. I need to figure those out before I give this a "fair" rating.
I own multiple copies of this game.
Thought I was going to like this game a lot more than I actually do.  The premise is sweet.  But the game can get repetitive.  plus I didn't win. :(
You know those bubble popping games you play on Facebook? This is the same thing.

I enjoyed this game a lot.  The premise of betting and "hoping" your creature survives is fun.  I think this game would be even more enjoyable with beverages.

Probably one of the best, "non-board" card games.
The first few times I played this, I did not play correctly.  Still trying to get this on the table a few more times, but may end up trading it away.
Confusion:  Espionage and Deception in the Cold War
All Cranium games suck.  I have never played any of these games that are challenging, or fun.  For some reason however, Soccer mom's however love them.
Great game, but you have to have 4 exactly. This makes it a problem to own.
I think this game had so much potential but failed in what was delivered.
Makes the game a lot more challenging than the base set.  Good luck escaping the caverns now.
The dice mechanic in this game is interesting and fresh. Although it still involves a lot of luck, this game is a great solitary game to play.
Good Filler game.  More of a party game than an actual strategy game.  Adults love playing kids games. :)

This is a great game for what it is. Think of it like a gamers version of Tic, Tac, Toe.

Knowing the tiles is incredibly helpful for playing this game.
Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
Too Euro. The game feels like it was designed to be mechanical, not very fun.
I have no idea how this won game of the year for kids. It is awful.
In depth, all strategy.  Make sure you time rounds.
Sorry or Parcheesi on crack. You have a partner, all movement is card driven and you can move backwards... Game is great!
Glorified Monopoly.  Cool Theme, but game play is not very challenging.

Nice game, but suffers from Burnout factor in my opinion.  It has the Werewolf symptom of everyone saying, "One more game?"  Doesn't get me.

I tend to play it on BSW, however, because it is a quick time burner.
Received as a gift from a friend for hosting a New Years Eve party.  Fun Party game.  Very light, enjoyable, and re-playable.
Neat game.  Has a good mechanic, however the whole game is built around that one mechanic.  Can be talked into playing it however.
I think this game is mediocre at best.
Okay game. Need to know the cards fairly well.
Very simple bidding game that is easy to introduce new players to Euro Style games.  Isn't a very good example of Euro style games, but will soften them up for more hardcore stuff.
This is a very interesting game.  Nice variability between plays.  Would like to play this a few more times, and really get a feel for it.
Too much stuff going on. I think it is a good game, but I would rather play something else.
Dungeoneer: Tomb of the Lich Lord
Interesting Game.  Have only played it once... Seems like a lot of rules, but once you get them down, I don't think it is a big deal.
Only played a few times.  Great condition.
When you don't have time to Role play.
Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
I have only played one campaign, but, I feel if I am going to play this, I would rather play Descent. However, that is not a co-op game.
Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
There are dice games that are fun, and then there are games like Easy Come, Easy Go.
Solid game. It feels similar to Stone age, but without the dice.
Blind Bidding Game.  Blind Bidding of obtaining resources, and of fighting for those resources.  Cute game with simple "attacking."
This is not for gamers. Just a heads up.
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Excellent Game.  After playing E&T (The Europe Release) I like that board much better, and I am looking for a European copy.  I am always willing to play this game.
Premise of the game sounds much better than it actually is.
You might as well just flip a coin to decide who wins this game, as opposed to actually playing it.

Game is partially broken, however, we play a variation where if the person "goes out" the first round... aka they have no money and can't make money, then they get 1 dollar each round.  Makes the game so no one goes out and can't come back in.
Felix: The Cat in the Sack
The best bluffing game, besides poker, that I have played.  Unlike poker the whole game is bluffing.
Not my type of game. Don't like spatial reasoning games. I would rather play something else.
Calling this a game is a stretch
Good in-between game.  Game can be explained in 3 minutes.
My daughter's new favorite game. Once she has a few plays under her belt, I will introduce her to the reality that is Pandemic.
Great party/activity game. Don't know about the re-playability factor though.
Game is about 20 minutes too long.
The Game of Life (40th Anniversary Edition)
Very strategic and enjoyable.  Light war game and fun for people who usually don't enjoy war games.  I however have to be in the right mood to play this game.
As a friend Charles says, "This game will kill your tichu game."  I agree.  If you play tichu, do not play this game.  I much prefer tichu over it, which is probably why it is rated so low.
Becomes more of a "let's dump the lead player into Lake Michigan game" more than actual strategy.  The game didn't strike me as super complex or having a lot of strategy, not my cup of tea.
Truly awful. No skill involved. We quite half way through.
Cute, but playing for second doesn't bring out the best in people.
Very simple, fast game.  A little strategy and some co-operative play so that one person won't run away with the game.  Good filler game.
Glenn Drover's Empires: The Age of Discovery

I enjoyed this game a lot.  However, I do think that they could of made the board much smaller.  Supposedly the version I played was up to 6 players, and the version you can purchase is 5.  If I were to own this game, I would only purchase it if it was the 6 player version.
I would prefer to play this rather than Race for the Galaxy.  However, cards that change the actual winning condition of the game I do not care for.
Roll and move. Nothing more to it.
Wow? Really?  Yeah, I played it, so... so...  So!!!
Cute game, but not for hardcore gamers. Very fun with kids.
I like this game a lot, however I have decided that I am not very good at perfect information games when there is a lot of it.  In this game I feel like I am balancing things constantly.
Good auction game. I can't put my finger on why I don't like it. Just not my cup of tea. However, It is still a good game, just not worth owning.
Grand Cru: Heuriger und gemischter Satz
Hare & Tortoise light. Great game as a "Gateway" game.
The only thing I have to say after playing this and Mama Mia is what Joe said, "Where is the card game about Quiche?"
GUBS: A Game of Wit and Luck
Great kids game from Wolfgang Kramer. Similar to Big Points. It does involve dexterity, so if you have the shakes because you haven't had your booze... Don't play it.
Clever stock market manipulation game. I like that you have partial information from each player on your left and your right. Due to that, this game is the best "market" game I have played.
Neat game.  Has a good mechanic with the card placements.  Defiantly give it a try if you like Alhambra.

Great game. Have the game taught to you. Don't read the rules.

Also, Avoid 2 player. It is awful.

I can see why this game bridged the gap between roll and move games and Euro style strategy.  I would really like to test this game out with people who have never played Euro style games before to see what they think of it, and if it sparks interest.
Great Game.  I prefer it over Agricola.  Lot of pieces for your money.  :)
Le Havre Expansion: Essen Promo Cards
Henry VIII: Intrigue in the Tudor Court
Too many rules for a simple Kosmos box card game. Meh.
Game would of been much better if they just made it a hot potato instead of a hex.  Much more difficult to get people to play it when I pull it out saying, "We cast hexes on each other"
Good Partner game. I would like to see a tournament for this game at some point.
The Hobbit: The Defeat of Smaug

This is a very different game that is very enjoyable. Unique mechanics all over the board. Essentially, a big version of paper/rock/scissors, but there is strategy into playing specific things based on your position.
Clever racing game. Makes you shout at your horse to cross the finish line.
Fun for adults who have been drinking.
Had a great time playing this, however, you do need the right crowd. Will not work with the wrong people.
There's a pig.  It is floating in the Sky.  There is a wheelbarrow on it's back that is filled with Pine nuts.  In the distance, below the pigs back left leg is a clown riding a unicycle.
I have only played with 6, but feels like it is about 20 minutes too long.
Meh. Press your luck game involving dice.
Cute game. I think that the only number to play this game with is 4.

Didn't like this game the first time I played it, however, after playing it again I really enjoy this game.  There is a lot of things going on with this game and multiple strategies that can be used to succeed as being the winner.
In the Year of the Dragon

I have played this game a few times now, and I do not care for it.  It is not the pain of the game that I don't like, because I normally like that kind of thing.  I think the problem with the game is at the end of it, I want my time back.  I would rather play something else than In the Year of the Dragon.

Excellent one-pass bidding game. Takes a few plays until you understand the value of items, as is all bidding games.

The German labels do not hurt the game at all.
Very Mediocre. There is nothing about this game that really stands out.
Great Game.  A lot of fun, some strategy, a lot of luck.  Game's premise is that you are all tinkering goblin's making machines that affect one another.

Not really into "abstract" games.  I don't really care about a theme to a game, cause I don't think it matters, however, I like there to be one none the least.  

This is a great game though to play with people that don't regularly game.  I would play this with my mother, grandmother, and girlfriend (now wife). :)

If you are going to play a deduction game their are much better deduction games with less rules.

In addition, The board is horrific. It is very difficult to identify where you can move without having a few plays.
Meh.  Take it or leave it.
After the 2nd play, I don't think I care for this game. Too chaotic.
It was good. Don't know if I will play it again, but you definitely feel the stress of climbing a big cold mountain.
I think this game is good, however, It seems like it would play much better on a computer. It is very difficult to look at the board and keep in mind some pieces are 0, etc.
I keep thinking about this game after I played it.  I will defiantly pick up this game if I ever see it.
Board game derived from lost cities.  Don't think I care for it, but still need to have a few more plays.
Nice game to branch from if players already have played something like settlers.  Map setup is one of the coolest parts of the game.
Game is very well themed.  A lot of cards you will get and won't be able to play so you have to hold them.  Rules are a little vague at times, but the game is fun and humorous.
Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
Great old school game. You need the right crowd of people to play with. Also, it is a game that people get kicked out of.
I have only played the java implementation of this game, with the AI.  But it's not bad.
The bluffing is what makes this game great.
Once this is all in English, I will PnP it.
Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game

A zombie game that actually works.  I personally like board games, and I like zombies.  I am glad that these two things can finally be merged together correctly.  It also comes with a soundtrack.  Word.
Legends of the Ancient World: Orcs of the High Mountains

Good Game.  ONE thing though.  Learn this game from someone else.  Do not attempt to read the rules.  The worst rules of any game I have attempted to play.  Took us an hour just to figure out what was going on.
One of my favorite bar games to play.
Wow. This game is awful. A "party" game, that gets you in fights with your spouse. This is in fact, the exact opposite of fun.
The Little Prince: Make Me a Planet
Great kids game that has some "gamey" stuff in it.
Clever memory game. Good for kids.

Neat game from a small company.  All of the games that come out of Winsome Games I wish had better production value.  Most of their games are a lot of fun, but just don't have the component value for what you pay for.

Going to need a few more plays of this game before the rating is final, however, Great game.

One of Wallace's best.
Cute Dexterity Game.  Even though I hate dexterity games, this one is simple and fun.
Lord of the Rings: The Adventure Deck Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game - Conflict at the Carrock
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game - The Hunt for Gollum
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lord of the Rings: The Duel

Enjoyed the game a lot.  The only drawback is the game is not made by a large manufacturer so the pieces are mostly folded paper instead of plastic/wood.  This is a huge drawback to the game.  The game play is great, you just need to see beyond the lackluster of the paper.

I want to like this game more than I think I do.

I removed the "Deal" mechanic completely from the game, and will need to try it with the dealing mechanic, before I pass final judgement.

The game does seem too long for what it is.
Good two player game.  Attempted to teach my mom, she got it after two plays. :)
Clever dice mechanic that takes some luck and a lot of planning.
Wow.  This game is great.  Lots of decisions.  However, My first play was with a german board.  I really wish that English printings had as much production value as german ones.
Clever game, which requires some memory. If I played this with my daughter, I am sure she would destroy me.
Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
These plays are mostly against a computer AI.
There is nothing here. The "fun" factor is lacking. I feel like I'm just going through the motions.
Need to play this a few more times. Only played with the 6-player expansion.
Game is more difficult when you are younger.  As you get older, the game becomes comical.

Great bidding game, probably one of the better bidding games out there.  Which is a BOLD statement.

However, the boards are awful. Horrible artwork.
Good game, I don't think however it is necessary to own this and power grid.  sure they play different, but they have a remarkably similar feel.
Proud owner of a copy created by Andrew Tullsen (Howitzer_120mm)
I would like the PnP version of this game... Beautiful Artwork.
Totally solid game. However, It is really mathy.

Fresh idea for a mechanic.  The only problem I have with the game is the ending.  Seems like once you need to bribe the guard the game is pretty much over.

Very Light.
Very simple game.  Horrible with two.  Best with 3/4.  The game is a very large min/max problem and is very fun even for someone who is not really into gaming.
Unique game that, according to legend, was developed due to a misinterpretation of the bidding rules from Goa.  Game concept is fun and very simple.
Have only played this as a solitaire game. Cute tile laying game. I think it would be a fun game for kids, but overly simple for adults.
Not my type of game.  Don't like racing river boats... no fun for me.

Modern Art is probably one of the best "bidding" games that I have played.  Has all aspects of bidding (secret, once around, open bidding, etc).  Game becomes better once people realize what the art is actually worth.
Everytime I have played this, I have won.  Well that's not true, but the people I beat are still alive.
Wow. There is a lot of Take That in this game.
This game is not as bad as you think. It is short, you are forced to purchase and make trades.
Lighter version of many racing games, including Formula D. Great one for kids to begin learning Euro style games. Teaches Tactical thinking and planning.
Moongha Invaders: Mad Scientists and Atomic Monsters Attack the Earth!

Nice filler game. Easily played with Kids.

There will never be a winner... Only a clear loser.
Did anyone actually play this game?  I just built the trap let it go, and that was the end of my enjoyment.
Great two-player game. If you are looking for a game to play with your wife or girlfriend that will keep them interested, this is one to try out.

You need to play this with the same group over and over to get enjoyment out of this.

Even though I rate this a 3, if I was stranded on an island with 4 other people, I would bring this game.
One of the better Haba games I have played. For a kids game this has some nice features in it.

Cute game.  Humorous if you have played D&D style games before.  The only way that I think I can see myself wanting to play this game is the way that I saw it getting played at a Conference.  The players had two Blackjack shoes (holds 7 decks of cards each), every expansion and they had one shoe for the treasure and another shoe for the doors.
As always, need to play again before rating.  Got to the end, and realized we were playing wrong the whole time.
Alright game.  I think that White Wolf could of made it a little easier by removing a bunch of the pieces.  Seems like there is an easier way to fix some of the hand/resource management.
Great kids game. If you have kids and they have a sleep over, this is the game to have on hand.

This is hands down, the Best CCG I have ever played.  The only issue is that there are a few decks that seem broken due to expansions for the game never being released.  I actually rate this game at 8.5, but it was throwing off my recommendations, so I dropped it down.  This is due to the fact that I am not into CCG's.

I don't know what I think about this game mainly due to the fact that the rules kept changing on me. :)  First play problems.  I would like to play this a few more times before I rate it "correctly" but the initial rating is 6.5
Rules are rather confusing, but alright game.  It actually worked pretty well as a intro Carcassonne game.
Enjoyable, quick, party game.  Great for in between games.  Simple concept and very addictive.

This game is not bad.  It is just not my cup of tea.  There is too much emphasis on if you are losing, you have to dig yourself out of the hole, and by the time you do the game is over and you have very little VP's.
Fun for the young ones.  The game does have strategy involved, and could probably become more cutthroat the more you play it.  I however did not care for the theme of the game.
Too much luck involved to make it involving. Rather Random drawing. :(
I would be willing to try this again, however, It seems the game is really broken.
This is a great filler and an excellent PnP.
This is one of the better Nestor Games I have played.
Outlaws: Adventures in the Old West
Great stock manipulation game for people who don't like stock manipulation games.
Weak Sauce. That's all I have to say.
Cooperative game that is very exciting and very challenging.  Difficulty can be adjusted based off of how hard you want the game to be.
This game is great. One of the best party games I have played. A must own!
Enjoyed this game, but it can defiantly be a runaway if the players are not experienced.  The strategy of the game is to get two of one resource that makes it cheap to purchase future resources.
Cute kids game. Works well with kids and adults. I think it is best with 6. Good with 3 also.
The old, cut the sandwich other person picks which side they want.
Owned.  Played once.  Got rid of it.
Great Party game.  Only suggestion is that you should play only the maximum amount of people.  The louder everyones personality the better. DO NOT play this game with introverts.
Simulates coaching a baseball team. What makes this game great is the ability to actually simulate games before they happen. Very fun.

Fun little PnP. Is a bit too long for a short afternoon play. However, that may be the point. The whole point of the game is to be stealthy when you play, so maybe the creator wanted it to be a time burner.
Classic hand management. Played with 4 people (3 adults and and 8yo) and 8 year old destroyed us.
One of the worst games I have ever played.
Mechanics work very well with this game.  Doesn't let anyone get to the top to fast, but I believe that the bidding is the most important factor in winning the game.
Good map, didn't play with purple but played a 6 person game.  Much different from the US map due to the no nuclear facilities areas.
One of the most thoughtful expansions to any game I have played.
Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards
I was pretty bored when I played this. Feels like there is too much downtime.
Game is great, however... It gets really old after playing a while, similiar to Settlers.  If you haven't played it.  Do.  If you have played it and only want to play it.  Branch out.
Great kids game that adults can play w/o the kids. Strategic, fun, and interesting.
This game has NO skill involved.  The best part of the game is the funny name combos that the animals have like "Grokinspine" but other than that... DULL.
Imagine Scrabble for people who don't have a big vocabulary.  This is game that works very well for people who aren't into games at all, and very simple to teach.
This game suffers from AP problems with gamers. This sums it up, "The game is good with non-gamers."
Need game.  Fun to teach the kiddies about the environment.  If you play with teen's, you will hear many a joke/reference to "dumping" while playing the game.
Fun, Pure bidding game but you are limited in what your bid totals are by the tokens you receive from the game.  Enjoy the mechanic.

I would categorize this game as a "Euro" card game.  This card game has a bunch of strategy and it is different each time you play.  I would like to see a tournament of this game some time in the future as it would be really interesting to see the diversification in strategies that each person would use.

One problem that I have noticed with this game is it is very hit or miss.  Originally I enjoyed playing it, now I seem to avoid it at all costs.  I will play it if there is really nothing else to play.

Update: This game you have to play 20-30 times before you get it. That is quite an investment to make for any game.
Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
If you are going to pull this game out, I think you are much better off playing Age of Steam.  This game is way to large for it's purpose.
Railways of the World: The Card Game
Age of Steam Express. Great game with fast play.
Meh. Have to play with the right group. The right group, is not gamers. Lots of Bluffing involved.
Cute card game.  I don't think the risk of going for pairs is worth it.  Seems like the better option is going for flushes with cards that potentially connect.

I used to play this game in college with a deck of cards. Rat-a-tat-cat is a re-visioning of Jack's and 5's.

The addition to the game is "special" cards. These cards add abilities that have a single use.
Very unique. Haven't figured out the "winning" moves. But I am willing to play until I figure it out.
This game is not fun. This game is work. Yet, I will play it and I rated it a 6.
After playing this, I had to purchase. I want Hasbro to release an entire line of games like this. Classic games that can be modified and personalized over time.
This is the WORST Winsome game I have played. I usually enjoy Winsome games. This one, however, I do not.
Cute game that has an excellent story behind it.  Entertaining to say the least.
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
For a few cards. There is a lot of game here.
Another great game that I am horrible at.  Are we seeing a trend here. :)  It is hard to get on the table due to people getting burned out on it when it first game out.
I own this game, and prefer it to RftG.  I  completely agree with Aaron Lawn about Race being overdeveloped.  This game is much lighter than race, and I find it more enjoyable.
Only play with 5, so that there is conflict every round.
Die Säulen der Erde: das Kartenspiel
This is one of the games that I originally enjoyed before I got into Euro style games.  I play it on occasion and it is still fun.

Cute kids game involving blowing pirate ships with a rubber bladder.

Don't know how well this would translate to the adult world.
The classic, "my vocabulary is bigger than your vocabulary", game.  Take it or leave it.
Great game to introduce a US game player to some Euro mechanics.  Still involves Dice Rolling.
Good Game with some neat mechanics.  All the mechanics I have seen before, but the game is fun to play.
I wanted to like this game way more than I did.
Would like to have the new version from Queen Games.
Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Okay. I don't get what the big deal is.
Fun little party game.  Probably one of the better party games I have played.
Expansions for this game are difficult to rate, because they are just more questions.
You better read BGG a lot in order to master this expansion.
I liked it except, the two games I played after that, the turn order messed me up.
This is probably the best "market simulation" game that I have played. It is a great Dirk Henn game that is not very well known.
Great when I was a kid. Awful as an adult.
Star Trek: Customizable Card Game (first edition)
Start Player: A Kinda Collectible Card Game

Not so good with 3.  Pretty Interesting with 4.  Seems like the money you make during the game is worth nothing.  It is all about diversifying your blocks in the end game, and maximizing what routes you don't share.
One Play. Set Collection. Feels similar to Union Pacific or Acquire.

Original Comment:
I don't care for this game and don't see what the big deal is.  Let's roll some dice.  Woot... meh.  Not for everyone.

Later Comment:
After playing this game quite a few times I like it much more than originally thought.  Although I will look for something else to play before I play this, Stone Age is an overall fun game.

I tend to play this game a lot more on BSW.
This is a war game disguised as a Euro game. Opposite of Twilight Struggle.
After playing this. I don't know if I want to play with just the base game anymore. I think this is a requirement for playing Suburbia.
Succession: Intrigue in the Royal Court

Very light.  The game seems like it wasn't play tested very well.  One of the characters has a huge advantage over the others by allowing him not to get "demoted" on the lines of succession.  Game needs to be changed up a lot to compete with other games of this nature.
One of the few games I "understood" right away. Very clear strategy for me to understand.
Played Once and Won at MeepleFest 2010!
Good game. Too much luck involved to get a higher rating, but I had a great time playing it.
There is a lot of game here. A few more plays will be required before making a final judgement. It actually may be too heavy for me.
Thought I would love this game because of the premise, but thought it was okay at best.  Not really interested in ever playing it again.
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization

Excellent game.  Very reminiscent of civilization for the PC.  Can be a very long game.  The more you play, the more you like it.  Downside is there is lots of downtime in the game.  In fact there may be too much downtime.
Neat little game that feels like a light version of Go.  Control territory, while making your opponents limit theirs.  Great min-max problem type of game.

This game is like dominion improved. It is still a deck building game with lots of variety and has Dungeon Crawling also.

Expansions will greatly improve this game.
In my opinion this expansion complicates the game. I feel it takes the fun out of it.
Solid Game and enjoy this much better than the follow up.  I also suggest to learn this before the follow up game.  I was trying to use the strategy from the newer version as opposed to this one.
Thurn and Taxis: Power and Glory
Played this version before playing the original.  Didn't really care for it, seems rather long and monotonous.

Very addictive game that sticks with you after you play it.  The only problem with the game is I would like to play it a lot, but I think it may be difficult to find 3 other people that want to play it as often as I do.

Update: I have been playing this a lot, and I am going to try to take a break from it, mainly because I feel like I am playing it all the time.
Good game for introducing people to the hobby.  Don't think I will ever own it though.
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 - Team Asia & Legendary Asia
Game is very interesting.  Incorporates some aspects of 1910 expansion, but also introduces passengers.  Which really add to the dynamic of the game.
Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
Ticket to Ride: The Dice Expansion
Meh. I like the cards better.
If you play this game, you have to have the expansion.  Makes the game much more dynamic and fun.  If I ever purchase this game, I would only buy it with the expansion.
Played this when I was 10 and thought it was a waste of time then, and a waste of time now.  However in college, probably affected my quarters game. :)
Cute little party game.  DO NOT play this with people who do not know popular culture.
Who doesn't like Time's Up?  This version is a little easier to play with kids.

Game is more random than I usually like, however I got a kick out of it since I haven't played a lot of dice games.  Game is unique as in you need to manage the amount of dice you get and the amount of dice manipulation cards you get.  I would suggest playing it at least once to see if it's up your alley or not.
Thought this was going to be much better than what it was. Too difficult to know what you played and hard to wrap your head around how to make good connected lines.
I enjoy this game, but was too tired to figure out the correct math for the game.  After a few more plays, might figure out what the math side strategy is.
Simple, light, and fun. Great filler.
Nope.  Tracing a path for zen is not fun.
Dexterity Games, throw dice down a ramp... meh.
The Twelve Doctors: Doctor Who Card Game
Be prepared to play this all day, or set an ending time.  Played with 6 people and 4 moves took 4 hours.  Great fun, but can break friendships.  :)
This is a war game disguised as a Euro Game. Opposite of Stronghold. This game is incredible.
Africa light. Good game, but a little too light for my tastes.

Different game.  I enjoyed the three stages of the game.  All of us were totally surprised at who the winner of the game was because we totally reversed order.  I had the most income at the beginning phase and ended coming in last place.
Damn you spacial reasoning skills!!!  I am horrible at games like this.  They frustrate me, more than relax me.

Oh, it's ultimate alright.  If you are going to buy Werewolf, this is the one to get.

If you have never played werewolf, jump on the band wagon.

Purchased this game from Ted, and played it a few times with different variations on a cruise with 13 or so people.  Much better than the original, and a good way to spice up things with regular wolf players.

I will never rate this entry for the pure fact that it encompasses many games.

I do enjoy playing prototypes and if I needed to "rate" how I feel about prototypes, I would give them a 7.
Want the PnP Version... THIS IS A LOT OF WORK.
Great game with more depth than it seems. This game needs to be re-themed and reprinted. Totally an underrated game.
Nice re-theme to a Classic Rummy Game. Cards are pretty and game has some replay value.
Very strategic.  One of the more unique games that I have played.  By unique I mean that the mechanics are very different.  Does involve Die rolls (D10).
Great buy for $10.  Bidding system is neat and who can beat the premise of building a casino?
Great game. Was introduced way late to it and should of played it since it came out.
Fairly unique and very strategic.  Very similar to the WoW CCG.
A little long, but fun. Seems like it would be difficult to play as the fellowship.
Warhammer: Invasion - Path of the Zealot
One of the hidden Gems of Essen 2010
I love China, I love Web of Power.  I really like the board and love the double scoring of regions.  May have to change my China rules to accommodate.

I don't think we were playing this right. The rules were unclear when it came to our specific questions.

Lots 'o dice rolling.
Compared to the other versions of this game. This is not as highly rated. If you want a werewolf set. Look into getting [Gameid=38159].
Different Game from GMT.  Most games are War games.  This one is not, and is great fun, especially with the max of 5 people.
Wings of War: Watch Your Back!
Come on Brown... Come on Black... Come on Green... Meh.

One of the better party games that I have played.  Only gripe is the way that the coin you originally used also counts as a bid.  Hard to pay out and remove tokens because of it, but all in all a great game.
Much better version of Wits and Wagers. I use the questions from the original, but the bidding method is much better in the family version.
Classic trick taking game.  Resurfaced "Oh Hell!".  If you don't make your tricks then it is painful.  Game can become stale if played too much.
World of Warcraft Trading Card Game

As all CCG's spend a bunch of money, get a lot of cards, build some decks and have fun.  The one unique thing about this game however is that it plays very similar to the MMORPG.  You have a tank/healer/dps, etc.  That is one of the cooler things about this CCG.
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game; Artumnis Moondream Character Pack
World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game; Dongon Swiftblade Character Pack
World of Warcraft: The Boardgame - Shadow of War
World War IV: One World, One King
Nothing like the card game. Some decision making to give it some strategy. Still a big aspect of luck involved.
Friends of mine love this. See it more as an activity.
Want to play this some more.
Roll Dice, Pull Dice, Mark sheet.  Pass Dice.  Repeat.
Good game, but there is too much to keep track of for my liking. I can be talked into it on occasion.
Not my kind of game. I may need to play it more?
I like this game. However, My wife won't play it with me. :(
No.  No.  No.  Not into dexterity games.

This game has some interesting mechanics. The most interesting being that you can't have the same amount of tiles as someone else.

Although this game has some unique mechanics, I don't care for the game. I think it is a brain burner for how light it is.
Cute Solitary game that is quick to play and burn 5 minutes. Card mechanic is reminiscent of Pocket Civ.
Zombie State: Diplomacy of the Dead
